intro: Lasiopogon brachypterus, commonly known as the short-winged leafhopper, is a small insect belonging to the family Cicadellidae. It is characterized by its slender body and short wings, which are typically held roof-like over the abdomen. This plant-feeding insect is often found on grasses and other herbaceous plants, where it feeds on sap. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a herbivore that can influence plant health and ecosystem dynamics. The species is also of interest in studies related to plant-insect interactions and pest management.
